text: Yahweh’s Day of Vengeance
Who \add is\add* this, coming from Edom,
from Bozrah \add in\add* bright red garments?
\add Who is\add* this honored in his garment,
lying down in his great strength?
“\add It is\add* I, speaking in justice,
⸤mighty⸥\f + \fr 63:1 \ft Literally “great” \f* to save!”
Why \add are\add* your garments\f + \fr 63:2 \ft Hebrew “garment” \f* red,
and your garments like he who treads in \add the\add* winepress?
“I have trodden \add the\add* winepress alone,
and there was no man from \add the\add* peoples with me.
And I trod them in my anger,
and I trampled them in my wrath,
and spattered their juice on my garments,
and stained all my clothing,
for \add the\add* day of vengeance \add was\add* in my heart,
and the year of my blood-vengeance has come!
And I looked, but\f + \fr 63:5 \ft Or “and” \f* there was no helper,
and I was appalled, but\f + \fr 63:5 \ft Or “and” \f* there was no one who sustains,
so\f + \fr 63:5 \ft Or “and” \f* my arm came to assist me,
and my wrath ⸤was what⸥\f + \fr 63:5 \ft Literally “it” \f* sustained me.
And I trampled peoples in my anger,
and I made them drunk in my wrath,
and I brought their juice down to the earth.”
Remembering Yahweh’s Mercy
I will mention the loyal love of Yahweh, the praises of Yahweh, according to all that Yahweh has done for us,
and \add the\add* greatness of goodness to the house of Israel that he has done to them according to his mercy and the abundance of his loyal love.
And he said, “Surely my people \add are\add* children; they will not break faith.” And he became a Savior to them.
In all their distress, ⸤there was no distress⸥,\f + \fr 63:9 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “he had distress” \f*
and the messenger of his ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 63:9 \ft Literally “face” \f* saved them,
in his love and compassion he himself redeemed them,
and he lifted them up,
and he supported them all \add the\add* days of old.
But\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Or “And” \f* they ⸤were the ones who⸥\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Literally “they” \f* rebelled,
and they grieved ⸤his Holy Spirit⸥,\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Literally “the spirit of his holiness” \f*
so\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Or “and” \f* he ⸤became an enemy to them⸥;\f + \fr 63:10 \ft Literally “was changed to them to one who is hostile” \f*
he himself fought against them.
Then\f + \fr 63:11 \ft Or “And” \f* his people remembered the days of old, \add of\add* Moses.
Where \add is\add* the one who led up them from \add the\add* sea with the shepherds of his flock?
Where \add is\add* the one who puts ⸤his Holy Spirit⸥\f + \fr 63:11 \ft Literally “the spirit of his holiness” \f* inside him,
⸤who made⸥\f + \fr 63:12 \ft Literally “bringing” \f* his magnificent arm move ⸤at⸥\f + \fr 63:12 \ft Literally “to” \f* the right hand of Moses,
⸤who divided⸥\f + \fr 63:12 \ft Literally “dividing” \f* \add the\add* waters ⸤before them⸥,\f + \fr 63:12 \ft Literally “from their face” \f*
to make an everlasting name for himself,
⸤who led⸥\f + \fr 63:13 \ft Literally “leading” \f* them through the depths?
They did not stumble like \add a\add* horse in the desert;
like cattle in the valley \add that\add* goes down, the Spirit of Yahweh ⸤gave him rest⸥,\f + \fr 63:14 \ft Literally “caused to rest” \f*
so you lead your people to make a magnificent name for yourself.
Prayer for Mercy
Look from heaven,
and see from the lofty residence of your holiness and glory.
Where \add are\add* your zeal and strength?
⸤Your compassion⸥\f + \fr 63:15 \ft Literally “The agitation of your intestines” \f* and mercy to me hold themselves back.
For you \add are\add* our father, although Abraham does not know us,
and Israel does not acknowledge us.
You, Yahweh \add are\add* our father,
Our Redeemer from \add of\add* old \add is\add* your name.
Why do you make us wander, Yahweh?
You harden our heart from your ways ⸤so that we do not fear⸥\f + \fr 63:17 \ft Literally “from the fear of” \f* you.
Turn back for the sake of your servants,
the tribes of your inheritance.
⸤Your holy people⸥\f + \fr 63:18 \ft Literally “The people of your holiness” \f* took possession for \add a\add* little \add while\add*;
our adversaries have trampled down your sanctuary.
We have been since antiquity; you did not rule them;
⸤they were not called by your name⸥.\f + \fr 63:19 \ft Literally “your name was not called over them” \f*
